subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You gain the following Channel Divinity options. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how Channel Divinity works.

entries.name: Oceanic Adaption
entries: You can use your channel divinity to adapt to the vast ocean. As an action, you can expend one use of your channel divinity and give a number of creature up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one) that you can see within 30 feet of you a swimming speed of 30 feet and the ability to breath under water for up to 1 hour as long as you are not incapacitated.

entries.name: Striking Wave
entries: Immediately after you deal damage to a creature with your Divine Smite feature, you can force that creature to make a Strength saving throw against your paladin spell save DC. On a failed save the creature is knocked {@condition prone}, as if struck by a wave.

subclassFeature.name: Seafaring Proficiencies
entries: At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item harpoon|OJS|harpoons}, navigator's tools and {@filter vehicles (water)|items|type=vehicle (water)}.

A harpoon is a martial weapon that deals {@dice 1d6} piercing damage and has the versatile ({@dice 1d8}) and thrown property (range 20/60 feet). Using a harpoon underwater does not impose disadvantage. In addition, when you hit a creature at most one size category larger than you with a harpoon, you can force it to succeed on a strength contest against you or be pulled up to 20 feet towards you.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Sea Spells
rows: {@spell create or destroy water}, {@spell fog cloud}

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Sea
entries: A paladin who assumes the Oath of the Watchers swears to safeguard the sea and all protect all seafarers from harm.

subclassFeature.name: Ranged Smite
entries: Starting at 7th level, you gain the ability to use your divine smite feature on ranged weapon attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Raging Sea
entries: Starting at 15th level, when you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal lightning damage to the attacker. The damage equals your paladin level. The attacker must also make a Strength saving throw against your paladin spell save DC. On a failed save, the attacker is pushed in a straight line up to 20 feet away from you.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of the Sea
entries: You can empower yourself with the might and rage of the sea. As a bonus action, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You gain resistance to cold, lightning and thunder damage.
You gain swim speed 60 feet and the ability to breath under water.

As a bonus action, you can choose one creature you can see with in 30 feet of you. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your paladin spell save DC. The target takes {@damage 4d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can use your reaction forcing the creature to make a Constitution saving throw against your paladin spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend a 5th-level spell slot to use it again.
